alert.note: Alert for Llano (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 6:29AM CDT until October 27 at 12:12AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Llano River at Llano affecting Llano County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Llano River at Llano. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding threatens docks and boats in the flood plain downstream in Kingsland. Secondary roads and bridges will be flooded and dangerous to motorists. Flow exceeds the USGS 1:2 year flood level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:10 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 14.6 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon to 5.4 feet late this evening. It will rise to 9.0 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.6 feet on 06/01/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Llano River Llano 10.0 11.9 Thu 6 am CDT 6.8 5.6 4.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM CDT.
